str2: From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make to rise, I rise, shine (generally of the sun, and hence met.). From ana and the base of telos; to arise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Evil, bad, wicked, malicious, slothful.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary word; 'good'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To moisten, rain, send rain. A primary verb; to moisten.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.
And, even, also, namely.
Unjust, unrighteous, wicked. Specially, heathen.
